“Rodya, you’re not leaving today?”  
“No!”  
“Will you come again?”  
“Yes … I’ll come.”  
“Is it far where you’re going?”  
“Very far.”  
“What awaits you there?”  
“What God sends … only pray for me.”  

Raskolnikov turned to leave, but his mother clutched him.  
“Not forever, right? You’ll come tomorrow?”  
“I will, I will. Good-bye.”  

He hurried home, wanting to finish before sunset.  
Nastasya watched him intently.  
“Has someone come to see me?” he thought.  

He opened the door. Dounia sat alone, deep in thought.  
She rose, dismayed, eyes fixed on him.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov expresses a sense of urgency and emotional turmoil as he prepares to leave, reassuring his mother while feeling the weight of his actions.
